    • named

      public SC_Number.SC_Number_Condition named(String fieldName)
      Add a descriptive name-tag for the number being checked (will be mentioned in logs) This is optional, you can also simply continue building the check (i.e. with SC_Number_Condition#isLarger()...)
      Specified by:
      named in interface SC_Number.SC_Number_Named
      Parameters:
      fieldName - The name of the number to be checked
      Returns:
      An SC_Number.SC_Number_Condition to continue building the check (i.e. with SC_Number_Condition#isLarger()...)

    • elseBreak

      public void elseBreak() throws SanityCheckException
      Executes the defined sanity check. If the check fails, a SanityCheckException is thrown.
      Specified by:
      elseBreak in interface SC_Number.SC_Number_Response
      Throws:

    • elseLog

      public void elseLog()
      Executes the defined sanity check. If the check fails, a message is logged as a Logger.INFO log msg
      Specified by:
      elseLog in interface SC_Number.SC_Number_Response

    • elseReplaceWith

      public Number elseReplaceWith(Number defaultValue)
      Executes the defined sanity check. If the check fails, the provided default value is returned (with an INFO log msg) Otherwise, the original value is returned. NOTE: Your originally provided SanityCheck.thatNumber(yourNumber) is NOT changed. NOTE: It is your responsibility to "catch" the replaced Number here, for example with double testedNumber = SanityCheck.thatNumber(yourNumber).is...().elseReplaceWith(9999)
      Specified by:
      elseReplaceWith in interface SC_Number.SC_Number_Response
      Parameters:
      defaultValue - The value to return if the check fails.
      Returns:
      The original value if the check passes, or the defaultValue if it fails.
      Throws:
      INFO - if condition failed and default-value was returned
